content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 99 ยง 26.1 - Executive Order. No. 26: Statewide Language Access Policy

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on October 6, 2011, I issued Executive Order 26
establishing New York's first statewide language access policy; and
WHEREAS, Executive State agencies have successfully
implemented the mandate of Executive Order 26, including facilitating the
translation of thousands of vital documents and providing countless New Yorkers
with oral interpretation services to ensure individuals with limited English
proficiency can access important programs and services; and
WHEREAS, the State remains committed to ensuring that
language access services are implemented in a cost effective and efficient
manner; and
WHEREAS, the diversity of languages spoken by New York State
residents has increased in the years since the issuance of Executive Order 26; and
WHEREAS, New York State's commitment to providing language
access services is a reflection of the State's dedication to welcoming and
supporting all New Yorkers, regardless of their country of origin or the
language that they speak; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Andrew M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby amend Executive Order 26 as follows: * Executive State agencies that provide direct public
services shall translate vital documents, including, essential public documents
such as forms and instructions provided to or completed by program
beneficiaries or participants. The translation shall be in the ten most common
non-English languages spoken by individuals with limited-English proficiency in
the State of New York, based on United States census data, and relevant to
services offered by each of such agencies. Translation shall be achieved on a
rolling basis to be completed no later than August 1, 2022. * Each such agency shall publish a language access plan that
will reflect how the agency will comply with this Order and all progress since
it last submitted a language access plan. Such plan shall be issued by August
1, 2021, and updated bi-annually on every August 1st thereafter. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: March 23, 2021
